Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey-black in section, the interior bears traces of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of two parallel lines of cord-marked decoration.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394359) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394359)
